text: Gérard Vergnaud (8 February 1933 - 6 June 2021) was a French mathematician, philosopher, educator, and psychologist. Vergnaud was a professor emeritus of the Centre national de la recherche scientifique in Paris. He was known for his creation of the Theory of Conceptual Fields.Grossi, Gabriel Pilar "Gérard Vergnaud: Todos perdem quando a pesquisa não é colocada em prática" Published by Magazine Escola, 23 October 2010, accessed 29 January 2011. He was born in Doué-la-Fontaine, France. He graduated from HEC Paris in 1956 and from the University of Geneva in 1968.L’AMQ se souvient Vergnaud died on 6 June 2021 in Paris, aged 88.Vergnaud, Gérard Michel ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website https://www.gerard-vergnaud.org Category:1933 births Category:2021 deaths Category:French mathematicians Category:French philosophers Category:Academics of Paris universities Category:French psychologists Category:People from Maine-et-Loire Category:Alumni of HEC Paris
